product_overview: Antigravity is a modern, responsive web application built with React and Vite, featuring animated and interactive sections to present company information, services, and portfolio in an engaging way.
core_goals: Provide a visually appealing and interactive website with smooth animations and transitions.
Ensure responsiveness and accessibility across desktop and mobile devices.
Showcase company services, portfolio, and venue options effectively.
Enable easy contact with the company via a contact section with convenient features.
key_features: Fixed navbar with glassmorphism effect and mobile-friendly menu for easy navigation.
Hero section with animated background slideshow and engaging animations.
Services section displaying company offerings in a grid layout for clarity.
Portfolio gallery with hover effects showcasing projects visually.
Venue list with expandable accordion details to provide more information on demand.
Contact section with email copy feature to facilitate user communication.
Main app layout managing the structure and flow of the application.
user_flow_summary: User lands on the homepage and navigates through sections using the fixed navbar.
User experiences animated hero slideshow and transitions for an engaging entrance.
User browses the services grid to understand company offerings.
User views portfolio items with interactive hover effects.
User explores venue details by expanding accordions for more information.
User contacts the company easily via the contact section, with option to copy email address.
User can navigate smoothly between sections on both desktop and mobile devices.
validation_criteria: All main sections (Navbar, Hero, Services, Portfolio, Venue, Contact) render correctly and respond to user interactions.
Animations and transitions perform smoothly without jank or delays.
Responsive design works flawlessly on different screen sizes and devices.
Mobile menu is fully functional and accessible.
Email copy feature in contact section works reliably across browsers.
Code adheres to linting rules with no errors reported.
App builds successfully without errors and passes preview tests.
